SFG.legacy.sfg module¶

class SFG.legacy.sfg.AddedName(names)¶

Bases: SFG.legacy.sfg.SystematicName

This class is derived from the SfgSpectrum and represents the result of the addition of Sfg intensities.

class SFG.legacy.sfg.AddedSpectrum(wn_intenstup, name)¶

Bases: SFG.legacy.sfg.SfgSpectrum

The result of the addition of two SFG spectra constructed by averaging over datapoints which are shared by the spectra. Note: If only one of the two spectra has the datapoint, it will be in the result spectrum with the same intensity value like in the original

class SFG.legacy.sfg.SfgSpectrum(wavenumbers, intensity, ir_intensity, vis_intensity, SystematicName)¶

Bases: object

The SFG spectrum class is the foundation of all analysis and plotting tools. It contains a class SystematicName (or a derived class) which carries most of the metainformation. Besides holding the experimental data, it gives access to a variety of functions like normalization, peak picking etc.

calc_area_per_molecule()¶

The function calculates the area per molecule. The area should be given in square angstroms, the concentration in milimole per liter and the volume in microliter

calc_dish_area(diameter=5.1)¶

A auxialiary function to calculate the area of a teflon dish in square angstroms. Diameter given in cm.

calculate_ch_integral(average='min')¶
correct_baseline(average='min')¶
create_pointlist(y_array)¶
detailed_analysis(threshold=2, intensity='norm')¶

Function returning peak information (central wavenumber, flanks, integral). The threshold value characterizes the factor that a peak must be greater than the average intensity

drop_ascii()¶

Create an ascii file with the wavenumbers and normalized intensities

drop_tex_peaktable(threshold=1.5)¶
get_sample_hash()¶
integrate_peak(x_array, y_array)¶

Numpy integration routine for numerical peak integration with the trapezoidal rule

make_ch_baseline(average='min')¶
normalize_to_highest(intensity='default', external_norm='none')¶

normalize an given array to its maximum, typically the normalized or raw intensity

root()¶
slice_by_borders(upper, lower)¶

Takes a high (upper) and a low (lower) reciprocal centimeter value as argument. Returns the indices o the wavenumber array of the spectrum that are the borders of this intervall.

smooth(points=9, order=5)¶

Apply a smooth routine to the normalized_intensity

yield_increment()¶

Calculates stepsize and wavenumbers where the stepsize is changed

yield_maximum()¶
yield_peaklist(mode='norm')¶
yield_spectral_range()¶

returns a list containing maximum and minimum wavenumer and the number of data points

class SFG.legacy.sfg.SystematicName(namestring, creation_time='unknown')¶

Bases: object

A class extracting metainformation from the string filename and storing it in rather self-explanatory variables.(eg date of measurement, type of surfactant…)

check_boknis()¶

Function determining if a spectrum belongs to the BE time series. Those follow a certain name convention

date_split()¶

Splitting the date which is stored as an integer (YYYYMMDD), extracting year, month and day information separately

is_number(s)¶

Auxiliary function returning e boolean, depending on test variable can be converted in a float

yield_info()¶
